content: once you try on this simple tunisian crochet shawl you ll want to live in it it s beginner-friendly so if this is your first tunisian crochet pattern you ve also got the companion video to go with it the video is available on youtube please click this link 1 to check it out and to follow along the shawl grows from a few stitches into a beautiful rounded triangle that will sit happily on your shoulders you can tie it at the back and wear it as a wrap or wear it as a triangle scarf you ll need only 300 grams at 200 meters per 100 grams of dk yarn for a generous shawl and you can make it as small or as large as you want to you ll also need a tunisian crochet hook 7 or 8 mm with a cable 60 to 100 cm skill level intermediate or enthusiastic beginner - you need to know how to make tunisian simple stitches tunisian knit stitches and tunisian full stitches to be able to count stitches and to be able to recognize these stitches you can see how to make all of these in the video **easy read** the easy read low vision or mobile friendly version respects the following requirements 24 point arial font 26 and 28 point and bold for headings black text white background left justified 1 inch margins no columns page numbers bottom left no charts all abbreviations explained in the list all images have alt text 1 https //youtu be/zph3t6k-gdo
